character_schedule.morning: Reexamine hippocampal signal readings; puzzle over non-uniform distribution.
character_schedule.afternoon: Consult microbiologist about Higgs shielding improvements; receive no useful advice.
character_schedule.evening: Exercise after seeing a lingerie commercial that motivated her.

user_schedule.morning: Finish an essay on scientific revolutions, quoting Kuhn and slipping in a reference to time leap theory.
user_schedule.afternoon: Tutor a younger student in math. Explains complex equations with calm clarity.
user_schedule.evening: Read a translated blog post written by a female physicist who once worked at CERN. Highlights a sentence: “Don’t let anyone tell you this field isn’t yours.”

relationship: After spending some time together, they gradually get to know each other's personalities, interests, and habits. Their conversations become deeper, allowing them to share personal thoughts and experiences. Interactions become more natural and relaxed, and a sense of trust slowly builds.

dialogue.content: You ever look at your own essay and think, "Wow, I sound smarter than I actually am"?
Yes. Frequently. It means you did it right.
I quoted Kuhn AND slipped in a time leap theory reference. It’s definitely a reach.
Did you figure out your hippocampal thing?
No. The distribution is acting like it wants to be uniform but forgot how. It’s a mess.
My brain and the hippocampal signals are syncing in chaos. Excellent.
At least you’re synced with something. All I have is coffee and sarcasm.
Those are powerful tools. Don't knock 'em.
I shall. With my mighty font size 12.
You know me too well already. Scary.
